The message and tensor rx_buffers are read-only locally and protected at the remote end by "remote_status_". I don't see same protection on the ack rx_buffer.
I need to think about the reason why ack buffers are treated differently.

body:
The message and tensor rx_buffers are read-only locally and protected  at the remote end by "[remote_status_](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/verbs/rdma.cc#L644-L645)". I don't see same protection on [the ack rx_buffer](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/verbs/rdma.cc#L628-L637).
I need to think about the reason why ack buffers are treated differently.
